TopicTitle: Choose your super power, then have it trivialized

Articles.Content:
Granted. Relativity remains intact, but ends up curled up in the corner muttering something about a ‘happy place’.

I wish that I could use Falcon 9 grid fins as waffle irons.

On 12/17/2018 at 4:02 PM, RealKerbal3x said:

I wish that I could use Falcon 9 grid fins as waffle irons.

The fins are so large, that the batter can't cling to the sides, and falls right through.   What does stick to the fins, you now realize Ti is not a non-stick material.  You then realize you spent around $100,000 on a giant fly swatter that the flies can go right through, and after trying to cook with it, all it does it attract flies. 

I wish my mouse pointer would stop twitching.

Spoiler

Ti-knives also rule

17 hours ago, Gargamel said:

I wish my mouse pointer would stop twitching. 

Granted. Now your mouse won’t stop twitching either. 

I wish I had additional hours in a day

You live on Mars and have 1 additional hour. You spend it to dress/undress the spacesuit.

A superpower to backup any moment.

You have the ability to beatbox like nobody ever believed possible.

I want power over mine enemies.

Edited December 21, 2018 by roboslacker

A balrog comes and burns your mine enemies, those dwarves.

A superpower to turn any piece of metal into mythril. And sell it for scrap.

The metal you create is worthless and you end up creating a free metal giveaway, benifitting all of society except you.

I wish I could update a mod when I want.

[not to insult the modding community, you guys are great}

Granted. You can update a mod anytime you want.

Whether the "update" is different from the previous version you downloaded is up to the author.

The power to engage anyone with scathing wit at any time.

Granted. You fall the first victim trying to test it.

A superpower to forgive the people who create a new type of the door latches every time.

15 hours ago, kerbiloid said:

A superpower to forgive the people who create a new type of the door latches every time.

You then realize the rest of the human population has opposable thumbs and can deal with new door latches without getting upset over them.

I wish for peace on earth.

Granted, but there's only a little of it.

I wish for a fancy potato.

You get a fancy suit of potato.

Spoiler

 

3 hours ago, Gargamel said:

the rest of the human population has opposable thumbs and can deal with new door latches without getting upset over them.

When the new types of latches work properly, what they usually don't do.

 

***

A superpower to make gold from nitrogen and oxygen.

You made evaporated Gold mixed with Nitrogen as a Boost propellant for your Nissan Skyline GTR, with thrust equivalent to a single unit of General Electric CF34. At least it's not the thrust of a single Pratt & Whitney JT9D-7 (Boeing 747, earlier variants) or General Electric GE90-115B (Boeing 777-300ER).

I'd like to have the superpower to compose an Electronic Dance Music easily, or simply using existent instruments as samples, then through a Music DAW, the sample is editable to create a unique tone or note.

Taisu grows green with envy and  kills you. 

 

the power to have an endless christmas break

This goes as well as winter. Long lasting winter. You know, it no longer become Global Warming, but vice versa. Global Freezing, where Earth temperature drops.

32 minutes ago, Fraston said:

Taisu grows green with envy and  kills you. 

 

 

I meant doing EDM just like e.g Alan Walker, Martin Garrix, etc.

 

The power of capturing a hill easily. In this thread :

Granted, but you're forced to give said hill to me

Power to rewind time and manipulate space time

Edited December 24, 2018 by qzgy

You rewind the time back, to the moment when you got this ability, and stick in the past.

A superpower to locate the time travellers.

There aren't any.

A power to control programs with my mind.

Your brain is now used as AI in a multiprogram washing machine to switch the programs.

A superpower to place the articles (grammar) correctly.

Granted, but the articles move themselves so you spend all your time herding them. And theyre like cats. 

Power to travel at the speed of light

Granted. Have fun being a force carrier—or at least you would have fun, if not for the pesky problem of not experiencing any time.

Power to throw projectiles with pinpoint accuracy, even in atmosphere, regardless of their size.

Granted. Every time you kick a ball, it hits a window.

A superpower to activate Windows.

Granted, but only for the 30 day trial period.

Power to change the viscosity of any materials I touch without changing my own

Granted. You have the finger stuck in your nose trying to nose-pick.

Power to recharge the phone from the closest public building.
